page.pageName: Cloudflare Developer Week 2022 - Updates and announcements

metaTags.metaDescription: Learn more about announcements and updates for Developer Week 2022

relatedBlades.title: Welcome to Developer Week 2022
relatedBlades.subtitle: All the building blocks to create & deploy full-stack applications on Cloudflare.

features.title: Welcome to the Supercloud (and Developer Week 2022)
features.description: Every developer wants to get code running on one machine and perfect it. It's so much easier to work that way. We just happen to have one machine that scales to the size of the Internet: a global, distributed, supercomputer. It's our Supercloud and we build our own products on it and you can too.

features.title: Build applications of any size on Cloudflare with the Queues open beta
features.description: Cloudflare Queues enables developers to build performant and resilient distributed applications that span the globe. Any developer with a paid Workers plan can enroll in the Open Beta and start building today!

features.title: The road to a more standards-compliant Workers API
features.description: Earlier this year, we announced our participation in a new W3C Community Group for the advancement of Web-interoperable API standards. Since then, this new WinterCG has been hard at work identifying the common API standards around which all JavaScript runtimes can build, and we've been hard at work updating the Workers runtime to conform to those standards.

imageAssetFile.altText: Wintercg Update + new web APIS update
imageAssetFile.title: Wintercg Update + new web APIS update

features.title: Cloudflare Workers scale too well and broke our infrastructure, so we are rebuilding it on Workers
features.description: DevCycle re-architected their feature management tool using Workers for improved scalability.

features.title: Announcing the R2 Super Slurper
features.description:
Moving terabytes of data from a cloud storage provider to a new one is always seen as problematic, involves planning, and likely requires staffing.
And that was hard. But not anymore.
Today we're announcing the R2 Super Slurper, the tool that will enable you to migrate all your data to R2 in a simple and efficient way.

imageAssetFile.altText: Migrate your data from S3 to R2
imageAssetFile.title: Migrate your data from S3 to R2

features.title: Reduce origin load, save on cloud egress fees, and maximize cache hits with Cache Reserve
features.description: Today we're extremely excited to announce that Cache Reserve is graduating to open beta – users will now be able to test it and integrate it into their content delivery strategy without any additional waiting.

features.title: Announcing Cloudflare Logs Engine
features.description: Today we're announcing Cloudflare Logs Engine — a new system that will enable you to do anything you need with Cloudflare Logs, all within Cloudflare.

features.title: Indexing millions of HTTP requests using Durable Objects
features.description: A deep-dive into how Cloudflare uses Durable Objects and the Streams API to index millions of HTTP requests stored in R2.

features.title: Seamless Postgres integration on Cloudflare Workers with Neon.tech
features.description:
Neon.tech is a database platform that allows you to branch your (Postgres compatible) database exactly like your code repository.
And with the release of their Cloudflare Workers integration you can get started in minutes.

features.title: Get started with Cloudflare Workers with ready-made templates
features.description: Today, we're excited to share a collection of ready-made templates to help you build your next application on Cloudflare Workers.

features.title: UPDATE Supercloud SET status = 'open alpha' WHERE product = 'D1';
features.description: As we continue down the road to making D1 production ready, it wouldn't be "the Cloudflare way" unless we stopped for feedback first. D1 is now in Open Alpha!

features.title: Making static sites dynamic with Cloudflare D1
features.description: In this blog post, I'll show you how to use D1 to add comments to a static blog site. To do this, we'll construct a new D1 database and build a simple JSON API that allows the creation and retrieval of comments.

features.title: Automate an isolated browser instance with just a few lines of code
features.description: Workers Browser Rendering API is our out of the box solution for simplifying developer workflows, including capturing images or screenshots, by running browser automation in Workers. If you're interested, sign up for the waitlist.

contentfulAsset.description: Illustration of Developer Platform building blocks

features.title: Iteration isn't just for code: here are our latest API docs
features.description: We're excited to share that the next iteration of Cloudflare's API reference documentation is now available. The new docs standardize our API content and improve the overall developer experience for interacting with Cloudflare's API.

features.title: The Cloudflare API now uses OpenAPI schemas
features.description: Cloudflare now has OpenAPI Schemas available for the API. Users can use these schemas in any open source OpenAPI Tooling.

features.title: Bringing authentication and identification to Workers through Mutual TLS
features.description: We're excited to announce that Workers will soon be able to send outbound requests through a mutually authenticated channel via mutual TLS authentication!

features.title: Xata Workers: client-side database access without client-side secrets
features.description: Xata is on a mission to solve the industry's hardest data problems with their Serverless Data Platform. We're excited to have Xata building their serverless functions product – Xata Workers – on top of Workers for Platforms. Here is Xata's story.

features.title: Announcing the first Workers Launchpad cohort and growth of the program to $2 billion
features.description: Announcing the Fall 2022 cohort of 25 Workers Launchpad startups and growth of the program from $1.25BN to $2BN

imageAssetFile.altText: Workers Launchpad Winter 2022 Cohort + Additional VC Partners
imageAssetFile.title: Workers Launchpad Winter 2022 Cohort + Additional VC Partners

features.title: Spice up static sites on Cloudflare Pages with Pages Functions
features.description: Pages is officially a full stack platform with Pages Functions now Generally Available. Pages is harnessing the power and scalability of Workers and specializing them to align with the Pages developer experience.

features.title: Server-side render full stack applications with Pages Functions
features.description: Page Functions are now out of beta, bringing the ability to add dynamic server-side rendering to your applications. Pages makes it easy to deploy applications built using all the major frameworks. There is no better time to start deploying your server-side rendered full-stack applications to Cloudflare Pages.

features.title: The most programmable Supercloud with Cloudflare Snippets
features.description: Today we are announcing Cloudflare Snippets. Snippets are a simple way of executing a small piece of Javascript on select HTTP requests, using the ruleset engine filtering logic.

features.title: Incremental adoption of micro-frontends with Cloudflare Workers
features.description: Large frontend applications are often hard to improve without major investments. With Cloudflare Workers, our fragment-based micro-frontend architecture, and fragment piercing technique, engineering teams can incrementally improve large frontends in a fraction of the time, yielding significant user and developer experience gains.

imageAssetFile.altText: Incremental adoption of micro-frontends with Cloudflare Workers
imageAssetFile.title: Incremental adoption of micro-frontends with Cloudflare Workers

features.title: How we built it: the technology behind Cloudflare Radar 2.0
features.description: Radar 2.0 was launched last month during Cloudflare's Birthday Week as a complete product revamp. This blog explains how we built it technically. Hopefully, it will inspire other developers to build complex web apps using Cloudflare products.

imageAssetFile.altText: How we build Radar on Pages + Remix
imageAssetFile.title: How we build Radar on Pages + Remix

features.title: Keep track of Workers' code and configuration changes with Deployments
features.description: Today we're happy to announce Deployments for Workers. Deployments allow developers to audit changes made to their applications.

features.title: How Cloudflare uses Terraform to manage Cloudflare
features.description: Cloudflare uses the Cloudflare Terraform provider extensively to make changes to our internal accounts as easy as opening a pull request.

features.title: Send Cloudflare Workers logs to a destination of your choice with Workers Trace Events Logpush
features.description: Workers Trace Events Logpush gives new levels of visibility into Workers invocations, console.log messages and errors. It is now available to everyone on the Workers Paid and Enterprise plans!

imageAssetFile.altText: Logpush for all workers customers for Workers
imageAssetFile.title: Logpush for all workers customers for Workers

features.title: Network performance update: Developer Week 2022
features.description: Cloudflare did the measurements to prove we're the fastest developer platform, beating out all the other competition.

features.title: Twilio Segment Edge SDK powered by Cloudflare Workers
features.description: With Segment Edge SDK, built on Cloudflare Workers, developers can collect high-quality first-party data and use Segment Edge SDK to access realtime user profiles and state, to deliver personalized app experiences without managing a ton of infrastructure.

features.title: How Cloudflare instruments services using Workers Analytics Engine
features.description: Learn how Cloudflare uses our own Workers Analytics Engine product to capture analytics about our own products!

features.title: Doubling down on local development with Workers: Miniflare meets workerd
features.description: Today, we're taking local development to the next level by releasing Miniflare 3, powered by the open-source workerd runtime, along with support for migrating existing dashboard projects and using real data locally.

features.title: Improving Workers TypeScript support: accuracy, ergonomics and interoperability
features.description: We're excited to announce the next major release of Workers TypeScript definitions with a bunch of improvements, and the open-sourcing of the new automatic generation scripts.

features.title: ICYMI: Developer Week 2022 announcements
features.description: This week we made over 30 announcements, in case you missed any here's a quick round-up.
